byline.original: By CARL HULSE and GARDINER HARRIS

abstract: Congressional Republican leaders and the Obama administration work their way through list of possible procedural options that could allow Obama's ambitious trade agenda to make its way forward despite opposition from House Democrats, who have rejected provisions giving president fast-track authority.
lead_paragraph: Congressional leaders and White House officials were looking for ways to resurrect trade legislation that stalled last week when House Democrats dealt President Obama an embarrassing defeat.

headline.main: House Republicans and White House Try to Revive Trade Bill Stalled by Democrats
headline.print_headline: House Republicans and White House Try to Revive Trade Bill Stalled by Democrats

snippet: Congressional leaders and White House officials were looking for ways to resurrect trade legislation that stalled last week when House Democrats dealt President Obama an embarrassing defeat.
